website_summaries.verdict: An affordable iPad stand that is portable and simple to use.
pros: Compact stand is designed to fit inside any bag or purse
Non-skid base ensures your iPad will stay in place consistently
Enables you to instantly position your iPad at virtually any angle
Sold with a one-year money-back guarantee
cons: Legs are sometimes uneven, which can make the stand wobble
Stand is flimsy in comparison to similar options

website_summaries.verdict: Very reasonably priced tablet stand used by many, supports most current iPad and e-reader devices.
pros: Compatible with most recent design iPads, Kindles, and other tablets and e-readers, independent of sleeve or case
Very portable size, fits easily in pockets and bags
Nonskid base to keep your device secure on flat surfaces
cons: Adjusting leg angles can be difficult, with more than comfortable force needed to do so
There were also some complaints about quality of certain parts/materials in this stand

customer_reviews.title: Don't by a more expensive one. Get this!
customer_reviews.text: I literally (and I mean that in the actual definition of the word) just opened it up and set my portable monitor on it (Asus MB169+) and it works perfectly. I bought a couple other (more expensive) stands which were nice, but I didn't feel like they were sturdy enough for my monitor. This is one is very sturdy and folds up nicely for portability.
customer_reviews.author: The Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great affordable stand
customer_reviews.text: Great affordable stand. Helped me turn my new IPad Air 2 and blue tooth keyboard into a mini "lap top." I have found the various positions that you can adjust for the stand to be quite a nice fit for my needs. I really like that you can bend the upper portion of the vertical support to get the best angle for your use. It also folds back up into a nice small size, making it very portable.
customer_reviews.author: Coffeelover

customer_reviews.title: Yes, it can hold the iPad Pro 12.9
customer_reviews.text: this adjustable stand can easily hold the new (2018) iPad Pro in both landscape and portrait mode. I absolutely love how compact it is when you close it up. only had a chance to play with it for a week. So far, so good. Time will tell how durable it will be long term. It seems like it will last a while. Even if it doesn't, it's a cheap product to replace it needed.
customer_reviews.author: The Night King

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and Inexpensive--Love It!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect stand for a tablet or a smartphone! It's inexpensive, lightweight but sturdy and versatile in that it easily adjusts to hold a variety of devices. I originally ordered several to go with the new Fire 7 tablets I purchased as Christmas gifts, but when I realized how well it would work for other devices, I also bought additional stands for my husband and myself to use with our Kindles. Highly recommended--we love it!
customer_reviews.author: FL Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Good looking build but no cigar.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my work tablet. The stand by looking on Amazon before I bought it looked sturdy,but when I received it isn't. Only configuration that holds the tablet is the picture I took. The places it has moving parts do just that they move there's no way to lock it to any position. You put the slightest pressure on table and the stand fails to hold its position. I'll use it in the 1 position that works . But I'm not expecting it to last to long due to the moveablilty of the parts.
customer_reviews.author: GOLDENDUDE

customer_reviews.title: It's great!  However, it needs more clearance at the bottom.
customer_reviews.text: The stand is nice. After adjusting it, the tablet fits nicely. The one issue I had with the tablet, is there is very little clearance at the bottom. Since my tablet is a Galaxy Tab S4, the charging port was foolishly placed at the bottom by the designers of the tablet at Samsung. So in order to avoid the problem , I put my tablet upside down. The tablet is able to detect the orientation and invert the screen. Now my charging port is on top. That is where it should have been put by the Samsung designers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not What It Seeim
customer_reviews.text: This product is so flimsy and small that it would not be sturdy enough to hold my cell phone let alone one of my Kindles. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great stand, great price!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my new 12.9" IPadPro. For the price I figured I'd give it a shot since some reviews said it worked ok in landscape mode which is how I use my IPad 98% of the time. The box was small & my kids laughed thinking there was no way it would hold this large IPad but it does just fine, even in portrait mode. It has a small footprint but feels sturdy enough to hold my IPad at any angle I want without fear of collapsing or tipping over. Combine function with the very low price & I'd recommend this to anyone looking for a stand for any tablet they have.
customer_reviews.author: StillaYankee

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy...RIP OFF
customer_reviews.text: It's felt like. It doesn't even have anything to sit on like felt will hold it on, it's not sticky or magnetic or anything to hold onto a tablet or smartphone.
customer_reviews.author: ANDEE

customer_reviews.title: A surprisingly good choice and will buy as gifts
customer_reviews.text: AmazonBasics Adjustable Tablet Stand - This stand is a beast. It's sturdier than it appears with a heavy plastic and rigid adjustments that clamps on firmly to its position. Its small and compact and has a soft yoga mat material under the legs and back rest. Its so well balanced I even watch my kindle with it on my stomach! A surprisingly good choice and will buy as gifts. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph O.

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Stand Doesn’t Exist......And I Oop..
customer_reviews.text: Listen, I buy a gazillion things a year from amazon. I’m pretty sure I am the reason they’re a trillion dollar company. But I never ever write reviews. Today, I actually stopped everything I was doing to come here and say how much I love this stand. It’s super sturdy, adjusts to many different positions, is compact and looks great. It holds my IPad Pro with ease. I spent almost 1k dollar on my iPad so believe me when I tell you this purchase is worth it. Maybe for future versions Amazon can make it even more compact and tiny so I can carry it in my pocket. But beyond that, it’s perfect.
customer_reviews.author: M.Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Great Handy Item
customer_reviews.text: You will not find a better stand to hold almost anything in any position. We have four of these around the house. I use it for my iPad and my phone while at the kitchen table every morning. My husband also uses it for his phone and Fire tablet. And we both use them for reading in bed with our Amazon Fire devises. Also, the price is great for such a useful thing. Don't waste you money on more sophisticated or expensive stands.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie B.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is the first iPad stand I've bought so I can't compare it to other products, but it's exactly what I was looking for. It's made from sturdy plastic, so I'm not concerned about it breaking during travel or just during regular use. The three arms fold together to form a little compact piece about the length of my hand, so it'll be easy to pack and take on a plane. During use, the stand was secure, no wobbles, and I was easily able to adjust it to the angle I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: forkdora

customer_reviews.title: I usually like AmazonBasics, but I am disappointed with this
customer_reviews.text: This product is extremely wobbly and cheaply made. I usually like AmazonBasics, but I am disappointed with this.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Holds anything from an iphone to an ipad
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to be able to stand up my kindle or iPhone while on a plane but realized I can also use it at home while FaceTiming or reading a recipe while cooking. Great for hands free use! The legs can be brought close enough to hold an iPhone upright. It might be a little wobbly on a plane in that position but it's definitely sturdy on a solid surface. It will hold any device with a case or cover on it. The only downside is that it doesn't hold the device quite high enough to have the charger plugged in at the bottom. But for the price and versatility, you can't go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Little House on the Prairie

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly with portable monitors
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this stand to use with a portable monitor. The monitor's included stand (a flip case) was close to useless. Luckily, this solved all the problems. It's a pretty basic device. Folded, it's about the length of a pencil and unfortunately, quite a bit bulkier. However, it has a quite a range of adjustment and I was able to position the monitor very close to optimal. Once setup, it's stable enough to use on a bed without much difficulty. The stand included with the monitor fell over if I looked at it strongly. SO all said, I am very satisfied with this purchase. It was inexpensive and works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Kwan L. Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Works as needed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I use my reader for textbooks. As I am studying I have found that I can read/see the ebook better when it is propped up during writing my assignments. I found this gadget and it was one of the less expensive ones on Amazon. I can adjust the stand for the height of the desk and angle needed to read comfortably. I actually bought two because sometimes I refer to two different textbooks and, therefore, I have two different readers. Both of my readers are in protective covers and this stand holds both of them without any issues of tipping or fear of instability.
customer_reviews.author: DeeDee Webster

customer_reviews.title: Does a Great Job of Supporting iPad for a Low Price
customer_reviews.text: The multi-articulation of this stand, together with the non-slip rubber pads on the bottom, the vertical pillar, and the rubber padding of the notches which hold the bottom end of the tablet make this stand a winner for not much money. I have two of these and both are wonderful and were delivered very swiftly via prime. There's no need to look further or spend more money.
customer_reviews.author: TWM

customer_reviews.title: Not very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I use a 10" Insignia tablet with this stand. The stand is not very sturdy in the least. Any tablet that is as tall at the one I use will create a top heaviness and render the stand very weak. If you tap your screen too hard, the stand will collapse sending your tablet to the ground. This stand packs up nicely to throw in any bag but the strength of the stand isn't very good at all.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kruse

customer_reviews.title: Love it!  Flexible yet stable
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to hold my iPads (one regular sized and one mini) when I’m cooking in the kitchen so I can have recipes at hand. I usually use the mini as it’s older and I care less about getting stuff on it, but I wanted something flexible enough to hold either, just in case. And this little gadget is perfect! It can adjust to fit either iPad, and has lots of configurations do you can hold your tablet in either portrait or landscape mode, and get just the right amount of tilt. Since it folds up to a very small size, I can toss it in my junk drawer when not in use. Definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: l3bowsk1

customer_reviews.title: Portable, Sturdy, Cost-Efficient Tablet & Phone Stand
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this stand for propping up my tablet in order to use it as an extra computer screen. Folds down to a very portable position (as can be seen in the pictures and original packaging box attached). Stand folds into each position with large clicks, preventing movement or unfolding when in use with a tablet in place. Nicely props up tablet, and quickly folds back down for portability. Also works well as a phone stand. Very satisfied with the purchase, rapid shipping which beats similar products available on Amazon (also seems to be the cheapest option). Would definitely purchase again! Will update review if any quality or longevity issues arise.
customer_reviews.author: Citrus Fruit

customer_reviews.title: So-so stand
customer_reviews.text: Not nearly as good as the I-home stand I got from Apple several years ago but is no longer available — at least I have been unable to find it. The Amazon stand tends to buckle when more than gentle pressure is applied to the screen. The screws holding the pieces together tend to loosen. Naturally this is remedied by getting a small screwdriver and tightening the screws. The more they are tightened, the more stable the stand. But then it is harder to adjust. Nevertheless, given the low price and the bulky size of the alternatives, this stand is ok.
customer_reviews.author: VirginiaHoosier

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice AmazonBasics stand
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased a few AmazonBasics products and I have never been let down by them. This one is no exception to that. I love that it is light, compact and easily adjustable. I originally bought this stand for my iPad Pro to use it as a second display on my MacBook and wondered if it would be too small. Since it's adjustable to different sizes, I was able to find a good fit for my iPad Pro. Also folds up nicely for travel (perfect for nights at the hotel when you want to watch a movie on your iPad and you place it on the bed).
customer_reviews.author: 7x1

customer_reviews.title: Just the thing for Zooming.
customer_reviews.text: I use this stand to hold my iPad in place for Zoom meetings, and nothing more. That said, it does the job and at a reasonable price. If I wanted to type while using it...well, who’d want to type on a pad standing in front of him or her? Maybe with an outboard keyboard, but there aren’t a lot of those and when I want to type or use any of many apps, I hold the Pad in my hands. When I first got the stand, I set it up cautiously, because the plastic legs take a certain amount of force to pull apart. But if they didn’t, I’d be worried that they wouldn’t hold.
customer_reviews.author: T. Everett

customer_reviews.title: ONE MAJOR DESIGN Flaw (update)
customer_reviews.text: Small, sturdy, holds the Ipad pro 12.9 inch ok. There is wobble if you press on it so this wouldn't be good for a drawing stand. The major DESIGN FLAW is the angle at which the feet cradles are cut. The iPad's point of contact is very very small even though it could be about a half an inch. Essentially the grooves are not parallel with the backrest. If this was fixed it would lead to greater longevity and tablet stability, I don't know how they missed this. UPDATE: WITH A LITTLE EFFORT THE FEET OPEN WIDER. I THOUGHT IT WAS BREAKING BUT NOPE! PERFECT ALIGNMENT.
customer_reviews.author: Antony P

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality and Easy to Use with any Tablets Folds Flat
customer_reviews.text: We use this with an IPAD and also have a less expensive tablet for reading. This stand will adjust for any larger tablet and hold it into place. The great feature is that it has small ridges to keep the tablet in place and you can adjust your angle of view for reading. High-quality construction 1. Universal Fit for Larger and smaller tablets 2.Adjustable for the best reading angles 3. High Quality stays in place during use 4. Folds flat when not in use
customer_reviews.author: Scott D

customer_reviews.title: Great for it's price
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive and does exactly what it is supposed to do. I like how adjustable it is so I can angle my ipad any way I want it. Sometimes use it for my phone too although it doesn't work as well because the phone is too small for it. Been using it for more than a year and it still works. However, the foam on the bottom that is supposed to help stabilize it has fallen off/no longer sticks to the product but eh, it's expected since it's just a sticker
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Neat little portable gadget!
customer_reviews.text: I can't rate its sturdiness yet, since I haven't had it very long; however, I really like its versatility. It adjusts easily, and fits my Kindle Fire in its slightly bulky case, plus also adjusts down to hold my Samsung Galaxy S9 phone. I like the variety of angle adjustments, too. Closes up neatly and fairly small for portability. I've wanted something to support my Kindly vertically, since my case only does it horizontally, and this has done the trick. Will update on sturdiness at a later date.
customer_reviews.author: cbb

customer_reviews.title: Great stand
customer_reviews.text: This is a great stand. I use it for both and huge iPadPro (about 13" screen), and a standard sized iPad (about 10" screen). It folds down really well into a smallish rectangular shape. It is maybe a little more bulky when folded than other stands, but is a really sturdy stand - so that's a good compromise. The flexibility of all the different positions is great.
customer_reviews.author: Amaramar

customer_reviews.title: Takes up too much table space
customer_reviews.text: This stand functions pretty well to hold my 10 inch iPad Pro, although I can't quite get an angle I like . YMMV. But my main gripe about it is that because of its design, it takes up too much table space as compared to other, smaller, stands. It occupies a six inch square on the table top, which might not sound like much but when you are doing something other than just having a cup of coffee, I find it hard to get it it acceptably positioned for reading.
customer_reviews.author: Harmon

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but ....
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty impressed with the product when it arrived. It is pretty sturdy, though a bit stiff, especially the legs. I used it for 2 days without any issues with both my phone and an iPad. Today when I was trying to adjust it on the table, the self-adhesive anti-skid material on the bottom rolled and stuck to the table instead of the stand. After pulling it mostly off before realizing there was an issue. I've tried to stick it back on, but I don't think it will stick well. Sigh! I actually liked this.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet for airplanes and kitchens
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a long flight with my 7and 5 year old. California to Italy. I loaded up the iPad with movies and games. This tablet holder was amazing the adjustments could fit any tablet, and the grip on the base insured it stayed in place on the tray table, even during some pretty strong turbulence. Now I'm back home and I use it in the kitchen and in my garage when I'm building something. Works great. Feels pretty durable too. Folds up nicely. Compact would be a good way of describing it.
customer_reviews.author: Pilar G. Vargas

customer_reviews.title: It's a UNIVERSAL mount.
customer_reviews.text: I have an old Samsung Tab E I use with my stereo system. Several of the apps I use don't work in landscape so I wanted a mount to hold the tablet in portrait. This looked perfect but it is VERY wobbly and the arm doesn't sit flush against the back of the tablet making it even more unstable. I don't trust it at all and it will just go in the mistakes pile. It is a universal mount so it is not designed for any device in particular and it clearly doesn't work for my needs!
customer_reviews.author: Dan The Driver

customer_reviews.title: i think i have four of these now
customer_reviews.text: I keep buying ones to live in each room and i just carry my tablet from room to room. I got tired of carrying the stand around and i don't like the cases with built in stands so this is my solution. theyre cheap enough i just have one in each room... just there ready to go for me. i use the tablet for different functions in different rooms but pretty much use it for everything all day long so the stands are great. theyre very sturdy and you just sit the tablet on it nbd.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: The stand itself is nice, but it does not fit the kindle fire ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to hold the kindle fire HD 8 (version 6) upright for games that did not work horizontally. The stand itself is nice, but it does not fit the kindle fire HD well while standing up as in the picture. I have to close the legs one notch each and I have very minor tilt / uneven-ness. It may not bother you, but it bothers me a little bit. For anything bigger than a kindle fire this would probably work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Brigandier

customer_reviews.title: I should have bought this stand ages ago!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have bought this sooner. It's great for holding my Fire tablet. I use it on my bedside table mostly and it prevents me from dropping it out of my hand if I nod off! I can't tell you how many times my Fire tablet hit the floor! Thank goodness it's still working fine. Really well made and sturdy, and very adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Linda J. Doffek

customer_reviews.title: Believe the other 5-star reviews.
customer_reviews.text: Short and simple. Like many of the other reviews say, it's honestly the best tablet stand I've had. I've had a few, and they all fall short. This one is extremely versatile, folds into almost any shape. I didn't think this would actually work for my cell phone - I thought it would be too wide. But I was able to get it into the shape I needed to work with my LGG8. I only bought one for my home office, but will be buying a few more for the office, other rooms, and even as gifts. A great buy!
customer_reviews.author: flapjackjoe

customer_reviews.title: Nicely designed
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a tablet stand so I could keep my tablet beside my desktop while I worked. I did not want a unit that took up lots of space. I read the reviews and decided to try this adjustable stand. First of all, when I am not using the stand, it folds up very small and barely takes up any space. Second, I can adjust it many ways to hold my tablet upright, sideways, leaning back further, etc. It is a pretty amazing design - like a little transformer toy - and very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: MCN

customer_reviews.title: It works...okay
customer_reviews.text: I got this stand for my 11in iPad Pro and it works... okay. I mainly got it to use on carpet and it’s not stable on that type of surface. I am a heavy handed person and it was easy for me to tilt my iPad over while typing, writing, or drawing. On a table it works great. Still kinda easy to tip over but it was harder to do so. It serves its purpose but it’s my fault for having expensive expectations for a cheaper product therefore I won’t give a bad rating.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Clunky and limited
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure this stand works fine for most people. However, I just did not like it. I took a chance because of the price and was still disappointed. The legs come with 3 preset spreadable widths. The articulating arm is neat in theory but weak in practicality. Just not a fan and can't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: AMT

customer_reviews.title: Homer un on product but they doubled the price.
customer_reviews.text: I had one it broke after 5 years that’s great wear and tear. Thanks 🙏 Bed bath and beyond sells 200 sheeets and a year later they are ripped or looked like they’ve been washed to much. Don’t buy beechwood sheets. Bottom line. Amazon if you guys read this maybe you can sell warranties on your higher priced items and extensions. That’s a thing that Lowe’s does and wearhouse discount center. Talk about backing up what you sell and making money as well for the warranty
customer_reviews.author: jim roberts

customer_reviews.title: Looks, feels and works great.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my Kindle Paperwhite. It has a great texture and look. The Kindle snaps in very nicely. The hinge works well on opening and closing so it feels like a unit either end - not wiggly or the like. I use it in a little reading stand and the cloth texture means it stays in place. It protects the Kindle too - the cloth cover is over a hard case. It adds very little weight, and I actually like this as it feels more like a book. I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Job S Tadoo

customer_reviews.title: Must have for tablet-style devices!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect device to hold up various tablet style devices. Used with 10.5-inch iPad and 8-inch Android tablet and it's great in that you can change the tilt angle. It has rubberized grips to keep the device from slipping, and collapses down to a very small size to easily fit in a backpack or purse. If you device doesn't have a built in kickstand and you want to prop it up in either portrait or landscape, this is the perfect gadget. Solid build but fairly lightweight. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Lance Y

customer_reviews.title: Wow. This is GREAT.
customer_reviews.text: This is such a simple device, but it worked perfectly. The plastic has a solid feel to it but is still light (making it perfect to tuck in your luggage or laptop case). I used it to hold a 15-inch portable monitor, and it worked perfectly. It also supported my 10-inch tablet. I think this is a really solid item for a fantastic price. I'm probably going to buy another one for my wife so she can watch Netflix on her tablet during lunch at work.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and Easy but with a Flaw.
customer_reviews.text: Can’t plug in a charger if using in portrait mode. Not enough clearance between the surface it’s sitting on and the charger port to fit the charger. (See attached picture). Only using the iPad in landscape orientation (sideways) allows for charging. Small, portable, cheap and easy. Folds up for easy portability. Plastic construction and might not last forever if you plan to open/close it a lot. Does the job but nothing special and not perfect I.e the charging issue.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: I was surprised at how strong and versatile!
customer_reviews.text: I had my doubts, I really did, as to whether this would be another flimsy one. I’ve bought a similar type before and I was disappointed and definitely wouldn’t trust it to hold anything larger than my phone. This one is surprisingly sturdy and has no problem with eith my iPad or with my Kindle Fire 10 HD- in either orientation. It folds up easily into a compact, very transportable size that I can stuff in a purse - or pocket, I guess if I had to! It was a smart buy. Inexpensive, sturdy, and does what it says it well.
customer_reviews.author: HarleyGirl

customer_reviews.title: Forget this for vertical use with iPad
customer_reviews.text: - Not heavy enough. Needs more weight in bottom for stability. - Slot on base legs for iPad not wide enough for thin cover folded back. - Does not sit high enough for placing iPad vertical. Like for reading news on table, reading recipes or next to stereo for streaming music — tight spaces where vertical is needed with power/charging or WITH lightning for power and/or DAC. So you have to invert it and have cables at top. Awkward.
customer_reviews.author: N. HylandTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Works great for iPad!
customer_reviews.text: Needed a sturdy stand to use for my child’s iPad for school during zoom meetings. This works better than the school issued iPad case cover that folds into a stand that kept falling down. I can use this Amazon stand with the case & keeps it in place! Nice, cheap & sturdy! Also like that I can easily fold it and stow it away when not needed. Great deal & does the job, no need to spend more $ on another one that takes up too much space!
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: It’s super affordable and it does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Its not a very flashy design, but it’s very affordable and it does the job :) :) I love to use my iPad in the kitchen with a recipe pulled up. I used to prop it up between the wall and a heavy container that would hold it in place, but now I feel more comfortable knowing it’s secure and won’t get scratched. I also travel a lot. I think it folds up nicely that I could take it with me on the plane to watch tv shows while in the air :)
customer_reviews.author: kristen

customer_reviews.title: Great for my laptop-tablet
customer_reviews.text: I needed to get a stand for my laptop that can convert into a tablet. I was skeptical of any I saw because I have a 17" laptop- so it's MUCH bigger and heavier than the average tablet. I tried this because it looked the most flexible and I'm so glad I did. It's not perfect (I can't manipulate the stand to ANY angle), but it's able to hold my laptop (folded in half) up so that I can use it as a standing tablet and I'm so happy!
customer_reviews.author: ALLFLUKSD

customer_reviews.title: Handy tablet support for a 12.9 iPad Pro
customer_reviews.text: I use this stand to hold a 12.9 iPad Pro for use as a second monitor, both at home and on the go. It holds the large iPad well in portrait and landscape modes, and folds up small for travel, fitting nicely in my bag. I haven't had any trouble with it folding under the weight of the iPad, but I'm also not pressing on the screen much.
customer_reviews.author: MntnMom

customer_reviews.title: 2nd stand purchased
customer_reviews.text: The stand meets my need to view my 10" tablet in portrait position. Stand is sturdy, collapsible, and if you position it correctly is very stable for touching screen while on the stand. I use it primarily when at kitchen table reading newspaper online. I had purchased one for my wife months ago and she is very pleased with the stand for her 10" tablet. So, after I got a 10" tablet I eventually decided I needed a stand so I didn't have to hold the tablet when wanting to view in portrait position while doing other things. My tablet has a cover for viewing landscape, but not portrait.
customer_reviews.author: A Harris

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little device
customer_reviews.text: I use this in cafes to hold either my phone or a Fire tablet, along with a Bluetooth keyboard. It took a bit of playing around, but now I can quickly set it up to hold my phone either landscape or portrait so I can do actual work in a Starbucks.
customer_reviews.author: Another Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Compact, but weird angles
customer_reviews.text: It's a cool concept and it really does fold up to a tiny size. It's also cheap enough that I don't expect perfection. My only gripe is that the adjustments are pretty big when you click it into position; that is, you don't have a lot of angles to choose from. So when I use it with a webcam, it's either chopping off the top of my head or the bottom of my head. I'd still give it three stars for people who use video chat a lot, or five stars for people who don't.
customer_reviews.author: Merry

customer_reviews.title: I usually love Amazon Basics products
customer_reviews.text: I usually love Amazon Basics products, but I'm mildly disappointed in this one. I figured an Amazon Basics tablet stand would work well with Amazon's own tablets. I have the 2017 Fire HD8 and, while this stand will hold it, it isn't as stable as I'd like. It seems pretty clear this stand was built with larger tablets in mind.
customer_reviews.author: J. Devenberg
